intro: Potentilla peduncularis var. abbreviata, commonly known as the short-stalked cinquefoil, is a perennial shrub native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow, five-petaled flowers in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are compound, consisting of five oval-shaped leaflets with serrated edges. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats.
